page.title: 07JACK FULLER
page.content: Jack Fuller was an M.P he had been left the Brightling Park mansion by MR Thomas Fuller who had rebuilt in about 1697 when he first purchased the mansion. Jack Fuller had a party in Londen while serving paliament he had a bet that he could see Dallington Church spire from his bedroom window but infact when he arrived home all he could see was Brightling Church so to save his money he had made the Suger Loaf which is approximately 35 foot high.So later when his friend came to secure the bet he thought that Jack Fuller had proved his point but really he had been deceived by Jacks forgery church spire .At one time a farmer nealy distroyed the Suger Loaf when he wanted to use the land for farming but the planning commissioner would not allow it.
